definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil

sentences.english: We are very happy to see our motherland becoming stronger.
sentences.chinese: 我們高興地看到，我們的祖國變得更加強盛。

sentences.english: Waiting my influence is strong, I will definitely come again to see yours.
sentences.chinese: 等我勢力強盛起來，我一定會再來見你的。

sentences.english: Only when the country becomes powerful and prosperous can families become rich.
sentences.chinese: 有了強盛的國，家纔會富起來。

sentences.english: When the city was feeling strong, the quirky philosopher could be tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 當這城市強盛時，他可以容忍這樣一個怪異的哲學家。

sentences.english: Today Sydney is the largest city in a powerful and prosperoous nation;
sentences.chinese: 如今悉尼市澳大利亞這個強盛國家的最大都市。

sentences.english: Gefei has repeatedly written the recession of "father" and the strong of "mother".
sentences.chinese: 格非多次寫到“父親”的衰退和“母親”的強盛。

sentences.english: So David waxed greater and greater: for the LORD of hosts was with him.
sentences.chinese: 大衛日見強盛，因爲萬軍之耶和華與他同在。

sentences.english: Its support and contribution played a great role in prospering the Wei Kingdom (one kingdom in the period of Three-Kingdoms).
sentences.chinese: 汝潁大族的支持和貢獻對曹魏的強盛起著重要的作用。

sentences.english: A country cannot become strong and prosperous if it does not make education universal and improve its quality.
sentences.chinese: 不普及和提高教育，國家不可能強盛。

sentences.english: Weijin and Northern and Southern Dynasties is the prosperous period of the patriarchal clan in the Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 魏晉南北朝時期是中國歷史上宗族強盛的時期。

sentences.english: China's prosperity day hope, concerted efforts must be achieved.
sentences.chinese: 中國強盛日日盼，衆志成城必實現。

sentences.english: Meeting name 《the controversy Sung Dynasty Cu Ju and citizen strength strong relation 》 .
sentences.chinese: 會議名稱《議宋朝蹴鞠與國力強盛關係》。

sentences.english: In this period, seemingly, the world was united, and the national power was strong.
sentences.chinese: 這一時期，從表面上看，天下統一，國力強盛。

sentences.english: And David became more and more powerful, because the Lord Almighty was with him.
sentences.chinese: 大衛日見強盛，因爲萬軍之耶和華與他同在。

sentences.english: But when he became powerful, his heart became proud.
Because thanks to the ocean and the Western world prosperity, depend on sea power and prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 西方世界由於得益於海洋而繁榮，依靠海權而強盛。

definition: descendants of the Fiery Emperor and the Yellow Emperor (i.e. Han Chinese people)
when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
prosperity and decline (of a kingdom)/rise and fall
internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
to surrender and pay allegiance to
